definition: system for identifying users (on a rail network, the Internet etc)
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
system/to control/to regulate/variant of 製|制[zhi4]

sentences.english: Please do not force them to use a real-name system.
sentences.chinese: 請不要強迫他們使用實名制。

sentences.english: China's mobile phone users will have to register using their real names starting next year, according to the Ministry of Information Industry (MII).
sentences.chinese: 據信息產業部消息，我國將從明年起啓動手機實名制。

sentences.english: Passengers could only book real name tickets by phone before Monday.
sentences.chinese: 在週一前，乘客只能通過點火預訂實名制火車票。

sentences.english: This makes the controversial network real-name registration system for years clear.
sentences.chinese: 這使得爭議多年的網絡實名制發展方向變得明朗。

sentences.english: Jack: I think the real-name system can effectively crack down on scalpers.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲實名制可能有效地打擊黃牛黨。

sentences.english: People purchasing large amounts of prepaid cards will soon have to reveal their real names.
sentences.chinese: 今後購買大量預支費卡將實行實名制。

sentences.english: The train ticket is lost, how to handle the loss formalities?
sentences.chinese: 在列車上丟失實名制車票，如何辦理掛失補辦手續？

sentences.english: I think the real-name system can effectively crack down on scalpers.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲實名制可能有效地打擊黃牛黨。

sentences.english: Time to get 'real' on China's Internet .
sentences.chinese: 國新辦稱，現在的中國互聯網必須推行實名制。

sentences.english: Jack:I think the real-name system can effectively crack down on the ticket scalpers.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲實名制可能有效地打擊黃牛黨。

definition: binding (loanword)/to bind (e.g. an account to a mobile phone number)
to bear joint responsibility for sth/joint liability (law)
to crack down on/to take severe measures against
ability to make one's own decisions
to transfer (money to a bank account)
